sourceMeaningMnemonic: Saying you're going to <radical>slide</radical> the <radical>dirt</radical> out of your <radical>mouth</radical> is just another way of saying you're going to <kanji>announce</kanji> something. All that information is the dirt, and to announce that dirt you just slide it on out of your mouth. How's that for a visual?
meaningInfo: The next time you have something important to announce, calm your nerves by imagining dirt sliding out of your mouth. It's that easy!
readingMnemonic: Now that you're about to <kanji>announce</kanji> something important, you should maybe get it nice and smooth in your mouth so the dirt can slide out easier. So take a big gulp of <reading>Coke</reading> (<ja>こく</ja>). Coke is just like, the dirt of soda anyway, you know?
readingInfo: Imagine drinking some coke and then making an announcement. Try not to burp while you talk.
